pros: Lightweight; Comfortable; Breathable; Stable for pronators; Grippy; Durable
cons: Too much drop; Tall heel; Heel slip
RR_verdict: I am fond of using the Wave Rider 25 because it is a daily trainer that is flexible, comfortable, and perfect for heel strikers out there who need a ton of foam in the heel to softly dampen the impact. I find the shoe breathable, and light on the environment with its recycled mesh upper. It’s a great entry point into running shoes for the beginner runner but ultimately falls short for those looking for something a bit more high-performance.
awards: Top 24% in road running shoes, Top 26% in long distance running shoes
use: Jogging |, Walking |, All-day wear |, For beginners
